data.text:
5 things semester 1 at Delhi University taught me. 1. The semester just flies by, so spend time with the people you meet, âœ¨ youâ€™ll learn more that way, DU is DIVERSE TO THE T, and that makes you greatly exposed to local culture at a national scale. 2. The red bricks ğŸ§± of a university built more than 100 years ago have stored knowledge, listen ğŸ‘‚, absorb it. 3. Professors are more fascinating than your school teachers but nope, never going to be as caring, concerned or interested as your school teachers ğŸ§‘ğŸ« ğŸ˜­ğŸ’• 4. It is NOT important to be a part of societies, it is NOT THE ONLY way to learn about work culture, more often than not, they are toxic, so surely try out, but seek your own way, to be or not to be, pressure mat Lena ğŸ§šğŸ» 5. University is the best place for Testing out your little ideas ğŸ’¡ be it related to work, studies, extra curriculars or relationships. And just like that, a journey spanning over half a decade was brought to its conclusion! This past Saturday, I received my official doctorate degree from the Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi and Iâ€™m trying to settle in with the â€œalumniâ€ tag since. I have so much to write/speak about this journey, all these emotions welling up inside of me, so many memorable instances; that one post will never be able to cut it. Instead, I wanted to mention something from the graduation ceremony that resonated with me deeply and will stay with me for the rest of my life. So the chief guest for this yearâ€™s Graduation ceremony at IITD was Dr. (Prof.) Gagandeep Kang and in her address to the students one of the things she said was, â€œYou owe this education to the people of this countryâ€. Which is true, literally, as IITs receive huge subsidies and other benefits from the GoI. But that is not all. Remember everyoneâ€™s favourite line from Spiderman? With great power, comes greater responsibility. Well, we may not be spidermen/women but we sure as hell have a supercool institution behind us which nurtured us and allowed us to grow, and we do have a responsibility towards our people, our society to pay it back. We were urged to be thoughtful, relentless, and accommodating changemakers. I donâ€™t know how much change I will be able to bring about but Iâ€™m going to continuously strive for it. ps: This was also the first time my PhD advisor, Prof. Ravikrishnan Elangovan met with my parents and itâ€™s kind of unsettling to watch the only three people in your life whom you are not used to receiving compliments from, actually shower you with praises!ğŸ˜„ #iitdelhi #iitd #convocation #graduation #phd #lifeofphd #phdcareer #education #change #growth #india #indianeducation

Being yourself or adapting? A big conflict arises when we find ourselves in situations where we might have to choose- Should i stay firm to my principles? or should I change according to the demands of time? This is a tree that I saw in front of Ramjas, and what particularly attracted me was the fact that instead of cutting the tree down, the renovation project built the campus around the tree. Impressive, isnt it? Faced with challenges, much like this tree,if we stay stubborn to our roots, refusing to give in to the newer, developmental measures, we can find ourselves isoloted, and in a danger of being cut down. But at the same time, should we give up what makes us â€œusâ€?. No. The answer lies in flexibility and adaptability. This tree may have lost a few branches, but it still stands tall, having molded the wall around itself. What we need to focus on is, there are pressures in life that may force us to change our ways, or to bow down to the environment. At this time, we cannot afford to be stubborn. Maintaining our integrity, we must stay strong, and while reforming ourselves, we must seize the opportunity and make the moment ours. Who knew that a stroll around campus would ignite such insights that would compel me to face this question- to be or not to be? #du #campusmusings #fyp #linkedinengagement #delhiuniversity #change #adapt #ramjas #college #collegelife #kirorimalcollege #insights

Step into a realm where learning transcends traditional boundaries! At Infant Jesus High School in Cuncolim, Goa, we're redefining education through innovation and hands-on exploration. . Thanks to the invaluable support of Seva Sahayog Foundation and its CSR initiative, we've introduced a revolutionary mini science center within our campus. This dynamic space serves as a launchpad for students to immerse themselves in the fascinating world of science, with interactive exhibits and models sparking curiosity and deepening understanding. . Witness the sheer delight on our students' faces as they engage with our experiential learning environment! Every experiment becomes an adventure, igniting a passion for discovery like never before. . Join us in championing this progressive approach to education, where academic excellence meets hands-on learning. Let's inspire the next generation to embrace the joy of lifelong learning. . https://lnkd.in/dK4KcmJb . . . #infantjesushighschool #cuncolimgoa #handsonlearning #interactiveexhibits #sciencemodels #vibrantatmosphere #sevasahayog #csrinitiative #minisciencecenter #innovativeeducation #academicexcellence #loveforlearning #enjoyablejourney #memorableexperience #dynamicapproach #studentengagement #scienceeducation #learningisfun #educationalinnovation #goaschools #csrindia #csreducationprograms #corporatesocialresponsibility #socialresponsibility #corporateresponsibility #csrinitiatives #csractivities #stemlearning

OVER 10 lakh+ students appear for IIT JEE every year. A Meagre 2% Get In. 2 lakh+ students appear for CAT every year. A Meagre 4% Get In. There is this QUESTION surrounding these institutions ğŸ¤” â€“ What Happens Inside? â€“ Is The Pressure Too Much To Handle? â€“ Do Students Only Study? â€“ Is It Worth It? Nishant Shekhar's "The Game Of Power And Passion" addresses these questions for you. It is not your regular fun college book. It talks about the struggles and the thrills associated with the IIT life. It talks about politics and passion for a group and an institution. Most importantly, What I Love About It Is . . . It touches upon how learning outside of academics can shape one's personality and character for life. - What if a close friend has to repeat a year of school? How might this affect your life and relationship? - You're campaigning for a favorite candidate in a student election, but they don't get elected. How would you handle this disappointment? The book is like a modern Mahabharat - full of drama and surprises with a cast of characters, each playing their own role. Every incident connects to future events, like dominos falling. PS- If you want to learn about life, and also enjoy a fun humorous read, go for this one! PSS- Super late, But HAPPY DIWALI my LinkedIn Fam ğŸª”ğŸ’« PSSS- Thats my old man, He's Cool and yes we were twinning ğŸ˜‚ #collegelife #lifelessons #linkedinforcreators #MarketingStrategy
